DataElement.preferredName: Ophthalmology Assessment Slit-lamp Examination Complete Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The result of a determination of the visual capabilities of a person by completion of an ophthalmologic examination of the anterior segment of the eye using a medical instrument called a slit lamp evaluation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Determination of the visual capabilities of a person by completion of an ophthalmologic examination of the anterior segment of the eye using a medical instrument called a slit lamp.evaluation.

The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The result of a slit lamp examination.

PermissibleValues.value: Decrease in vitreous cells or retinal infiltrate
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Decrease in vitreous cells or retinal infiltrate

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Decrease in vitreous cells or retinal infiltrate
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease in vitreous cells or retinal infiltrate.

Deviating from the norm.: A continuous, insulating monolayer of cuboidal/columnar epithelium which extends from the margins of the optic nerve head to the ora serrata where it is continuous with the pigment epithelium of the pars plana. This cell layer has many physical, optical, metabolic/biochemical and transport functions which play a critical role in the normal visual process, including acting as a selective filter to determine what nutrients reach the retina from the choroid.

Concepts.definition: Deviating in any way from the state, position, structure, condition, behavior, or rule which is considered a norm.

A continuous, insulating monolayer of cuboidal/columnar epithelium which extends from the margins of the optic nerve head to the ora serrata where it is continuous with the pigment epithelium of the pars plana. This cell layer has many physical, optical, metabolic/biochemical and transport functions which play a critical role in the normal visual process, including acting as a selective filter to determine what nutrients reach the retina from the choroid.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Central Nervous System Lymphoma Recurrent Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Central Nervous System Lymphoma Recurrent Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that arises in the lymphoid tissue found in the central nervous system (CNS). The CNS includes the brain and spinal cord.: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: A non-Hodgkin or Hodgkin lymphoma that arises in the brain or spinal cord as a primary lesion. There is no evidence of lymphoma outside the central nervous system at the time of diagnosis.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.
